title: Searches Kaggle Platform for Data by Keywords
text: can install development version kaggling like : package relies valid installation kaggle (python 3 based package). includes Kaggle account authorization tokens API. Refer https://github.com/Kaggle/kaggle-api installation instructions.

title: Searches Kaggle Platform for Data by Keywords
text: Load package functionality:
code: library(kaggling) #> where is kaggle installed? #> Is API use authorized? Address any warnings.

title: Searches Kaggle Platform for Data by Keywords
text: main functionality centered searching data sets using search key word: Kaggle hosts 14 data sets found result search ‘ames iowa housing’.
code: ames <- search_kaggle("ames iowa housing") dim(ames) #> [1] 14  7 head(ames) #>                                                               ref #> 1                                               marcopale/housing #> 2 carlmcbrideellis/house-prices-advanced-regression-solution-file #> 3                        emurphy/ames-iowa-housing-prices-dataset #> 4               nabilabdul/ames-house-price-prediction-regression #> 5                    zeeshanmulla/advance-house-price-predicitons #> 6                           anishpai/ames-housing-dataset-missing #>                                               title  size         lastUpdated #> 1                            Ames Iowa Housing Data 397KB 2020-03-18 20:24:26 #> 2 House Prices: Advanced Regression 'solution' file   6KB 2020-09-11 15:40:17 #> 3                  Ames Iowa Housing Prices Dataset 190KB 2018-04-25 14:54:54 #> 4     🏘️Ames House Price Prediction Regression 🌎🚗🛣️  98KB 2022-07-20 12:01:40 #> 5                   Advance House Price Predicitons 274KB 2020-01-05 10:22:15 #> 6                   Ames Housing Dataset Engineered 192KB 2020-09-30 14:58:26 #>   downloadCount voteCount usabilityRating #> 1          3450        28       0.9705882 #> 2           985        39       1.0000000 #> 3           519         9       0.4117647 #> 4           118         8       0.7941176 #> 5           780         4       0.7058824 #> 6           204         6       0.9117647 library(tidyverse)  # the majority of the datasets has a size of about 200 KB.  ames %>% mutate(   size = parse_number(size) ) %>% ggplot(aes(x = size)) + geom_histogram()

title: Searches Kaggle Platform for Data by Keywords
text: data set identifier stored variable ref. Meta information extracted kaggle using function get_meta. get_meta expands dataset list variable meta.
code:
ames$ref[1] #> [1] "marcopale/housing" # single set of meta information get_meta(ames$ref[1])$meta #> [[1]] #>                  id  id_no datasetSlugNullable ownerUserNullable #> 1 marcopale/housing 545987             housing         marcopale #>   usabilityRatingNullable          titleNullable      subtitleNullable #> 1               0.9705882 Ames Iowa Housing Data for Regression Models #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         descriptionNullable #> 1 ### Context

The Ames Housing dataset is a great alternative to the popular but older Boston Housing dataset.


### Content

The Ames Housing dataset contains 79 explanatory variables describing (almost) every aspect of residential homes in Ames, Iowa with the goal of predicting the selling price.


### Acknowledgements

The Ames Housing dataset was compiled by Dean De Cock in 2011, for use in data science education.


### Inspiration

The Default task for this dataset is Regression. #>   datasetId datasetSlug hasDatasetSlug ownerUser hasOwnerUser usabilityRating #> 1    545987     housing           TRUE marcopale         TRUE       0.9705882 #>   hasUsabilityRating totalViews totalVotes totalDownloads #> 1               TRUE      22728         28           3452 #>                    title hasTitle              subtitle hasSubtitle #> 1 Ames Iowa Housing Data     TRUE for Regression Models        TRUE #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 description #> 1 ### Context

The Ames Housing dataset is a great alternative to the popular but older Boston Housing dataset.


### Content

The Ames Housing dataset contains 79 explanatory variables describing (almost) every aspect of residential homes in Ames, Iowa with the goal of predicting the selling price.


### Acknowledgements

The Ames Housing dataset was compiled by Dean De Cock in 2011, for use in data science education.


### Inspiration

The Default task for this dataset is Regression. #>   hasDescription isPrivate keywords_1  keywords_2 keywords_3 #> 1           TRUE     FALSE    housing real estate regression #>            keywords_4 licenses.nameNullable licenses.name licenses.hasName #> 1 ratings and reviews               GPL-2.0       GPL-2.0             TRUE ames <- get_meta(ames) ames_meta <- ames %>% tidyr::unnest(cols=meta, names_sep="_")  # There is a plethora of licenses involved ames_meta %>% count(meta_licenses.name) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   meta_licenses.name     n #>   <chr>              <int> #> 1 CC0-1.0                3 #> 2 GPL-2.0                1 #> 3 ODbL-1.0               1 #> 4 copyright-authors      1 #> 5 reddit-api             1 #> 6 unknown                7

what: Kaggle search results for diamonds — kaggle_diamonds
title: Kaggle search results for diamonds — kaggle_diamonds
text: Using kaggle API, dataset created Nov 18 2023 result searching keyword 'diamond'. list search results expanded meta information datasets.

title: Kaggle search results for diamonds — kaggle_diamonds
Kaggle search results for diamonds — kaggle_diamonds
text: data frame 163 rows 28 variables.

title: Kaggle search results for diamonds — kaggle_diamonds
text: first eight variables (slight) modifications dataset search kaggle API. variables : ref character vector form /. title character vector containing title dataset. size_value integer vector size dataset. size_unit one--two-character vector unit dataset recorded. element one "B", "KB", "MB", "GB". lastUpdated date time last update. downloadCount vector integers number downloads. voteCount vector integers number votes. usabilityRating vector numeric values scale 0 10 (extremely useable). remaining 20 variables part meta information uploaded datasets. Kaggle meta data described https://github.com/Kaggle/kaggle-api/wiki/Dataset-Metadata. follows Data Package specification suggested Paul Walsh Rufus Pollock. removed columns duplicated data.

title: Kaggle search results for diamonds — kaggle_diamonds
code: # example code library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(lubridate) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘lubridate’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     date, intersect, setdiff, union  # number of data sets related to 'diamond' by year kaggle_diamonds %>%     group_by(year = year(lastUpdated)) %>%     summarize(n = n()) %>%     ggplot(aes(x = year, weight = n)) + geom_bar()

title: kaggling: Searches Kaggle Platform for Data by Keywords — kaggling-package
text: Kaggle used platform offer participate data competitions thousands users. platform features easy upload mechanism data sets. date almost 300k data sets available platform. package provides access key-word based search available data sets based kaggle API.
